GT.content: Derrida thinking gift by way of idiomatic expressions: give a class, donner une facilité, donner le change [hunting expresson], etc.
GT.linkedContent: Derrida thinking gift by way of idiomatic expressions: give a class, donner une facilité, donner le change [hunting expresson], etc.

GT.content: via Mauss, difference btwn true money, non-true money & counterfeit money
GT.linkedContent: via Mauss, difference btwn true money, non-true money & counterfeit money

GT.content: “Counterfeit Money”: title of all fiction
GT.linkedContent: “Counterfeit Money”: title of all fiction

GT.content: this is perhaps counterfeit money: this perhaps is the intentional dimension[?], the credit, the act of faith that structures all money
GT.linkedContent: this is perhaps counterfeit money: this perhaps is the intentional dimension[?], the credit, the act of faith that structures all money

GT.content: Baudelaire’s “Counterfeit Money,” its play w/ title, links literature to belief, credit, thus capital, economy, politics
GT.linkedContent: Baudelaire’s “Counterfeit Money,” its play w/ title, links literature to belief, credit, thus capital, economy, politics

GT.content: literature & its relation to capital, city, polis, transformation of monetary forms [late capitalism] (dematerializaiton of money & all the scenes that depend on it)
GT.linkedContent: literature & its relation to capital, city, polis, transformation of monetary forms [late capitalism] (dematerializaiton of money & all the scenes that depend on it)

GT.content: Mallarmé links aesthetics w/ political economy via alchemy: alchemy as precursor to political economy, “null stone, dreaming of gold, once called philosophical…foreshadows, in finance, the future credit, preceding capital or reducing it to the humility of money!”
GT.linkedContent: Mallarmé links aesthetics w/ political economy via alchemy: alchemy as precursor to political economy, “null stone, dreaming of gold, once called philosophical…foreshadows, in finance, the future credit, preceding capital or reducing it to the humility of money!”

GT.content: isn’t counterfeit money the truth of capital? everything that depends on faith & credit?
GT.linkedContent: isn’t counterfeit money the truth of capital? everything that depends on faith & credit?

GT.content: playing w/ fors, fortuna, ferre (fer, ferre; in Greek, pherô) which means to bear, & fero, “I report,” counterfeit money carries us to heart of question of reference & difference,
GT.linkedContent: playing w/ fors, fortuna, ferre (fer, ferre; in Greek, pherô) which means to bear, & fero, “I report,” counterfeit money carries us to heart of question of reference & difference,

GT.content: dematerialization of money [late capitalism], can one quote money? fors, fortuna: Baudelaire reserves status of absolute exception for money (not the gift)
GT.linkedContent: dematerialization of money [late capitalism], can one quote money? fors, fortuna: Baudelaire reserves status of absolute exception for money (not the gift)

GT.content: Baudelaire’s future: a good sense that will condemn everything except money
GT.linkedContent: Baudelaire’s future: a good sense that will condemn everything except money

GT.content: [re: “Counterfeit Money”] only a liar could know whether friend gave real money, that is, a connoisseur of counterfeit money; so narrator believes, credits his friend
GT.linkedContent: [re: “Counterfeit Money”] only a liar could know whether friend gave real money, that is, a connoisseur of counterfeit money; so narrator believes, credits his friend

GT.content: [no depth beyond literary phenomenon] inviolability of secret depends on essential superficiality, bare device of being-two-to-speak (l’être-deux-à-parler), a secret beyond reserve of technique, thing, being, thing thought (same could be said for money)
GT.linkedContent: [no depth beyond literary phenomenon] inviolability of secret depends on essential superficiality, bare device of being-two-to-speak (l’être-deux-à-parler), a secret beyond reserve of technique, thing, being, thing thought (same could be said for money)

GT.content: as long as money counts, produces effects, as long as it assures finite possibilities of decision & judgment, it is simply not different from money it counterfeits > a more powerful but not infinitely powerful [?] inscription of effects of reference on truth, convention, dispositifs
GT.linkedContent: as long as money counts, produces effects, as long as it assures finite possibilities of decision & judgment, it is simply not different from money it counterfeits > a more powerful but not infinitely powerful [?] inscription of effects of reference on truth, convention, dispositifs

GT.content: opposition of conventional to natural is discredited, or, more rigorously, it is limited in its indispensable credit, in the speculation it will always have to authorize
GT.linkedContent: opposition of conventional to natural is discredited, or, more rigorously, it is limited in its indispensable credit, in the speculation it will always have to authorize

GT.content: chremastics vs. economy: 1) chremastics, ovular or seminal capital, “bad infinite” of money, no limit 2) economy, oikos, care for home, hearth, limited to necessary goods
GT.linkedContent: chremastics vs. economy: 1) chremastics, ovular or seminal capital, “bad infinite” of money, no limit 2) economy, oikos, care for home, hearth, limited to necessary goods

GT.content: limit gets blurred once there’s monetary sign, or simply sign, once there’s differance & credit, family no longer contained > this originary ruin is chance of hospitality—like counterfeit money, chance for gift itself [Aristotle looks for balanced limit, not Derrida]
GT.linkedContent: limit gets blurred once there’s monetary sign, or simply sign, once there’s differance & credit, family no longer contained > this originary ruin is chance of hospitality—like counterfeit money, chance for gift itself [Aristotle looks for balanced limit, not Derrida]

GT.content: nothing can happen w/out family & w/out economy, but neither can anything happen in family, family in sealed enclosure of absolutely restricted economy, w/out chrematistic vertigo
GT.linkedContent: nothing can happen w/out family & w/out economy, but neither can anything happen in family, family in sealed enclosure of absolutely restricted economy, w/out chrematistic vertigo

GT.content: khrema signals in direction of monetary sign; w/ “Counterfeit Money” we’re at heart of truth w/out truth, law w/out law, duty w/out duty concentrated & lost in enigma of khrē, khrema, khraomai: one must, need, lack, desire, be indigent poor, owe, ought, need, utility, interest, thing, event, fatality, prayer
GT.linkedContent: khrema signals in direction of monetary sign; w/ “Counterfeit Money” we’re at heart of truth w/out truth, law w/out law, duty w/out duty concentrated & lost in enigma of khrē, khrema, khraomai: one must, need, lack, desire, be indigent poor, owe, ought, need, utility, interest, thing, event, fatality, prayer

GT.content: Heidegger on gift, Heidegger discovers an etymology of khreon that links it to hand, to reaching for, also links it to logos > Derrida wonders about credit cards, coded signatures
GT.linkedContent: Heidegger on gift, Heidegger discovers an etymology of khreon that links it to hand, to reaching for, also links it to logos > Derrida wonders about credit cards, coded signatures

GT.content: also to khreon as presencing of what is present (das Anwesen des Anwesenden)
GT.linkedContent: also to khreon as presencing of what is present (das Anwesen des Anwesenden)

GT.content: the Good, in Republic, takes on features of father and of Capital, [Derrida’s fn references Dissemination, on bad faith of fraudulent merchandise, tampering w/ money, & on political economy] whereas Baudelaire is interested in copy of copy, phantasm
GT.linkedContent: the Good, in Republic, takes on features of father and of Capital, [Derrida’s fn references Dissemination, on bad faith of fraudulent merchandise, tampering w/ money, & on political economy] whereas Baudelaire is interested in copy of copy, phantasm

GT.content: “freedom” in Kant’s speculative philosophy [?] can’t be demonstrated, it’s a “letter of credit for the moral law,” an assumption; also that (diabolical) evil can never be a motive
GT.linkedContent: “freedom” in Kant’s speculative philosophy [?] can’t be demonstrated, it’s a “letter of credit for the moral law,” an assumption; also that (diabolical) evil can never be a motive

GT.content: faith/belief (act of faith/credit) given w/ monetary language, practical reason cannot be separated from chremastics as we interpreted it above
GT.linkedContent: faith/belief (act of faith/credit) given w/ monetary language, practical reason cannot be separated from chremastics as we interpreted it above

GT.content: true, authentic money, nature’s gift of a present
GT.linkedContent: true, authentic money, nature’s gift of a present

SPOM.content: money, spectralizing disincarnation, not lifeless body, but life w/out individual property, general property of money deprives all personal property (Eigentümlichkeit) of difference
SPOM.linkedContent: money, spectralizing disincarnation, not lifeless body, but life w/out individual property, general property of money deprives all personal property (Eigentümlichkeit) of difference

SPOM.content: Shakespeare understood this phantomalization of property > Marx: little connection btwn money, general form of property, and personal peculiarity (persönlichen Eigentümlichkeit)
SPOM.linkedContent: Shakespeare understood this phantomalization of property > Marx: little connection btwn money, general form of property, and personal peculiarity (persönlichen Eigentümlichkeit)

SPOM.content: becoming-god of gold, at once ghost & idol, a god apprehended by senses
SPOM.linkedContent: becoming-god of gold, at once ghost & idol, a god apprehended by senses

SPOM.content: via Marx, in Timon of Athens [see pp. 96-7 Marx’s play]: Timon’s trust in money (simulacrum, ghost), an oath, a giving credit, to that which is unworthy of oath; not convention society, or law > cult of money as nature, prostitution, thus constant perjury, simulacrum, greed

SPOM.content: money produces a remainder, is but a shadow of a great name
SPOM.linkedContent: money produces a remainder, is but a shadow of a great name

SPOM.content: via Marx, Schein-gold, money (Geld) as origin of spirit (Geist) and avarice (Geiz), transfiguring idealization of commodities: spectropoetic
SPOM.linkedContent: via Marx, Schein-gold, money (Geld) as origin of spirit (Geist) and avarice (Geiz), transfiguring idealization of commodities: spectropoetic

SPOM.content: the secret (Geheimnis) of the fetishism of the commodity, the “germ” of the money-form, une table tournante, example of an apparition

POOF.content: for Kant, crime against humanity would be to disdain currency, to take counterfeit money for counterfeit [skeptic betrays mankind] > for Kant, virtue obligates that we turn counterfeit (small change) into gold, becoming-truth of the simulacrum, its verification, authentication [pp. 257-58 rare friend keeps secret, renounces possible public profit, that of circulating secret]
POOF.linkedContent: for Kant, crime against humanity would be to disdain currency, to take counterfeit money for counterfeit [skeptic betrays mankind] > for Kant, virtue obligates that we turn counterfeit (small change) into gold, becoming-truth of the simulacrum, its verification, authentication [pp. 257-58 rare friend keeps secret, renounces possible public profit, that of circulating secret]

POOF.content: quoting Matthew, Derrida asks whether there isn't still profit of a sublime economy, economy beyond economy, in Nietzsche? or does the absolute gift (advising against love of one’s neighbor) break the ruse of this sublime economy? like Kant, isn’t there still best exchange rate for virtue?
POOF.linkedContent: quoting Matthew, Derrida asks whether there isn't still profit of a sublime economy, economy beyond economy, in Nietzsche? or does the absolute gift (advising against love of one’s neighbor) break the ruse of this sublime economy? like Kant, isn’t there still best exchange rate for virtue?

VM.content: inhabit metaphor’s ruins, s’habiller des lambeaux de la tradition et des haillons du diable: by using tradition’s words, one can use [them] up (user), les frotter comme une vieille pièce de monnaie fruste et dévaluée, on peut dire que la vraie extériorité est la non-extérioritée sans être l’intériorité, on peut écrire par ratures et ratures de ratures: crossing out writes, still writes in space
VM.linkedContent: inhabit metaphor’s ruins, s’habiller des lambeaux de la tradition et des haillons du diable: by using tradition’s words, one can use [them] up (user), les frotter comme une vieille pièce de monnaie fruste et dévaluée, on peut dire que la vraie extériorité est la non-extérioritée sans être l’intériorité, on peut écrire par ratures et ratures de ratures: crossing out writes, still writes in space

PP.content: Isocrates: sophists should pay since they are in need of such help from masters of logos

F.content: pocket near pudenda, extra flap of cloth, where most precious thing is kept: money, title, share in stock market [crypt as wallet]

WM.content: concept usure belongs to concept of metaphor itself: where does erosion begin and end w/in particular figure of metaphor? paradigms of coin/metal imposed w/ remarkable insistence
WM.linkedContent: concept usure belongs to concept of metaphor itself: where does erosion begin and end w/in particular figure of metaphor? paradigms of coin/metal imposed w/ remarkable insistence

WM.content: to signify metaphorical process, coins have often been used, analogy w/in language described by analogy btwn language and something other than itself > but that which seems to figure [i.e. coins] cannot be contained w/in regional science, linguistics philology: opens a discourse on figuration itself
WM.linkedContent: to signify metaphorical process, coins have often been used, analogy w/in language described by analogy btwn language and something other than itself > but that which seems to figure [i.e. coins] cannot be contained w/in regional science, linguistics philology: opens a discourse on figuration itself

WM.linkedContent: inscription on coinage, scene of exchange btwn economic and linguistic > the 2 types of signifier supplement each other in problematic of fetishism in Nietzsche & Marx

DS.linkedContent: double session finds its corner (coin) BTWN (ENTRE) literature & truth (that by which question “what is?” wants answering): figure of folding back, angle ensured by fold

DS.content: [re: Mallarmé’s use of Or] Or (substantive noun/adverb of time), gold turned to nothing; Igitur, adverb-name (also means “therefore”), has affinities w/ Or, or marks the hour (today) > temps d’or, “Il Signor,” “qui s’ignore,” “signe or,” in the golden antre of a glottis (glossa, gold ingot, lingot, lingua) > throw of linguistic dice
DS.linkedContent: [re: Mallarmé’s use of Or] Or (substantive noun/adverb of time), gold turned to nothing; Igitur, adverb-name (also means “therefore”), has affinities w/ Or, or marks the hour (today) > temps d’or, “Il Signor,” “qui s’ignore,” “signe or,” in the golden antre of a glottis (glossa, gold ingot, lingot, lingua) > throw of linguistic dice

DS.content: le son OR, le SON or (by way of lateral unconscious pressure)
DS.linkedContent: le son OR, le SON or (by way of lateral unconscious pressure)

DS.content: crisis of literature est marquée au coin de cet excès > figure of corner testifies to this in all its recastings/retemperings (corner, coin, angle, seal, fold, hymen, open recess, etc.) [coin-entre]

AFR.content: frivolity (useless) is the congenital breach of sign (its entame, archē), since structure of sign’s deviation ensures frivolity has no origin, frivolity defies archeology, condemns it to frivolity: excessive relief, not even money or merchandise > sign’s disposability never presents itself

OG.content: Rousseau’s pernicious habit of donner la change [satisfying his wants, sidetracking, giving money]
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau’s pernicious habit of donner la change [satisfying his wants, sidetracking, giving money]

OG.content: for Rousseau, child can’t relate to separated signifier, child will spontaneously donner la change, doesn’t treat l’argent pour l’argent > no relation to sign for itself, no fetish

OG.linkedContent: perverse use of signifier permitted & tolerated by imitation

OG.content: age of labor, civil society, l’homme policé, money & phonetic writing—elle gagne en universalité: signifiers that are nonsignifying, circulation of arbitrary signs in phonetic writing, alphabet is commercial, a trader > anonymous supplement substituted for a thing

SPEC.content: to describe structural necessity of borrowing as provisional/external fatality is classical logic [Freud often does this]: suspense is provisional, notes/coins must be guaranteed in final judgment

SPEC.content: speculation [beyond PP], investment made by borrowing, no possibility of amortization, no reconciliation by coins, signs, and their telos—promise more than can provide [formula of love?], insolvent—infinite debt, unpayable, thus beyond debt, violates economy of equivalence (not economy in general)
